src:
Srbija će sa pet predstavnika na Svetski kup
07 Nov 2019, 13:07 by Nemanja
Srbiju će na Svetskom kupu u Kini predstavljatji pet strelaca, saopštio je danas Streljački savez Srbije (SSS).
Sastav je nešto izmenjen u odnosu na onaj koji je objavljen početkom septembra.
Bobana Momčilović Veličković, koja se plasirala za finale SK vazdušnim pištoljem je otkazala učešće na takmičenju, pauziraće tokom prvog dela sezone zbog zdravstvenih razloga.
Šansu umesto Bobane Momčilović Veličković dobila je Jasmina Milovanović.
Naime, Milovanovićeva, koja je na poslednjem ovogodišnjem SK u Rio de Žaneiru osvojila bronzu vazdušnim pištoljem, je bila prva „ispod crte“ kvalifikovanih takmičarki. Posle odustajanja koleginice iz reprezentacije naknadno uvrštena na listu učesnica.
Srbiju će na finale SK u Putjenu predstavljati: Zorana Arunović (vazdušni pištolj), Andrea Arsović (vazdušna puška), Jasmina Milovanović (vazdušni pištolj), Damir Mikec (vazdušni pištolj), Milenko Sebić (MK puška trostav).
Pravo učešće na turniru u Putjenu stekli su branioci zlatnih medalja sa prethodnog finala Svetskog kupa, održanog 2017, osvajači odličja na Svetskom prvenstvu u Čangvonu prošle godine i još 14 strelaca prema bodovima skupljenim na turnirima SK u 2018. i 2019. Računa se samo takmičenje na kome strelac skupio najviše bodova, poeni sa više turnira se ne sabiraju.
Prošle sezone finale SK nije održano, jer je odlučeno da se ubuduće završni turnir Svetskog kupa organizuje svake neparne godine, a ne svake sezone (kao što je to bilo od 1988. do 2017).
Andrea Arsović je plasman na finale obezbedila kao osvajač Kristalnog globusa za trijumf na finalu SK 2017. u Bolonji,  Zorana Arunović kao svetski vicešampion, a ostali srpski strelci na osnovu prikupljenih bodova.
Andrea Arsović i Damir Mikec će poslednju proveru pred turnir u Putjenu imati narednog vikenda na turniru „Salona kup“ u Solinu , kraj Splita, na kome će učestvovati nekoliko naših reprezentativaca. Uz Arsovićevu i Mikeca, Srbiju će predstavljati i Sanja Vukašinović, Milutin Stefanović,  Marija Malić, Duško Petrov…

POVEZANE OBJAVE
text:
Serbia will take five representatives to the World Cup
07 Nov 2019, 13:07 by Nemanja
Serbia will be represented by five shooters at the World Cup in China, the Shooting Federation of Serbia (SSS) announced today.
The composition is slightly different from the one released in early September.
Bobana Momcilovic Velickovic, who qualified for the SK Air Gun Final, canceled her participation in the competition, pausing for the first part of the season for health reasons.
Jasmina Milovanovic was given the chance to replace Bobana Momcilovic Velickovic.
Namely, Milovanovic, who won the bronze with an air pistol at this year's SK in Rio de Janeiro, was the first "below the line" of qualified competitors. After the resignation of a female colleague from the national team, she was subsequently added to the list of female participants.
Serbia will be represented at the SK final in Puten by: Zorana Arunovic (air pistol), Andrea Arsovic (air rifle), Jasmina Milovanovic (air pistol), Damir Mikec (air pistol), Milenko Sebic (MK trosta gun).
The gold medal winners of the previous World Cup finals held in 2017, the winners of the Changwon World Championships last year and 14 other shooters according to points collected in the SKs in 2018 and 2019 are eligible to participate in the Puten tournament. to which the scorer has accumulated the most points, points from multiple tournaments are not added up.
Last season, the SK final was not held, as it was decided that in the future the World Cup final would be organized every odd year, not every season (as it was from 1988 to 2017).
Andrea Arsovic secured the finals as a Crystal Globe winner for the triumph at the SK 2017 final in Bologna, Zorana Arunovic as world champion, and other Serbian shooters based on points collected.
Andrea Arsovic and Damir Mikec will have their last check before the Puten tournament next weekend at the Salon Cup tournament in Solin, near Split, with several of our national team members. In addition to Arsovic and Mikec, Serbia will also be represented by Sanja Vukasinovic, Milutin Stefanovic, Marija Malic, Dusko Petrov…
